query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 O poca nostra nobiltà di sangue, 2 se glorïar di te la gente fai 3 qua giù dove l’affetto nostro langue,
query.error: **English:** 1 Oh, our nobility of blood, how little, 2 if people glorify you down here 3 where our affections languish,
query.result: 1 Ea, ure lytle æðelborennes, 2 gif ðu ðe selfne herige mid mannum 3 her niðer ðær ure lufu langað,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 mirabil cosa non mi sarà mai: 5 ché là dove appetito non si torce, 6 dico nel cielo, io me ne gloriai.
query.error: **English:** 4 will never be a wondrous thing to me: 5 for there where desire is not distorted, 6 I mean in Heaven, I gloried in it.
query.result: 4 wundorlic ðing ne bið me næfre: 5 forðæm ðær ðær wilnung ne bið awended, 6 ic secge on heofonum, ic me ðæs gefeonde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 Ben se’ tu manto che tosto raccorce: 8 sì che, se non s’appon di dì in die, 9 lo tempo va dintorno con le force.
query.error: **English:** 7 You are well aware that time quickly shortens, 8 so that, if you do not add day to day, 9 time goes around with its forces.
query.result: 7 Þu eart wel gemyndig ðæt ðeos tid hrædlice gebrinco: 8 swa ðæt, gif ðu ðe ne geornæst dæghwamlice, 9 se tima gæð ymbutan mid his mihtum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 Dal ‘voi’ che prima a Roma s’offerie, 11 in che la sua famiglia men persevra, 12 ricominciaron le parole mie;
query.error: **English:** 10 From the 'you' that first offered itself to Rome, 11 in which its family persevered less, 12 my words began again;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 onde Beatrice, ch’era un poco scevra, 14 ridendo, parve quella che tossio 15 al primo fallo scritto di Ginevra.
query.error: **English:** 13 whereupon Beatrice, who was a little withdrawn, 14 laughing, seemed like the one who coughed 15 at the first written fault of Guinevere.
query.result: 13 ða wearð Beatrice, ðe wæs sum deal tosceaden, 14 hlihhende, swilce ðeo ðe hreahte 15 æt ðæm æroran write Gwineferan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 Per tanti rivi s’empie d’allegrezza 20 la mente mia, che di sé fa letizia 21 perché può sostener che non si spezza.
query.error: **English:** 19 Through so many streams is my mind filled with joy, 20 that it makes gladness of itself, 21 because it can endure without breaking.
query.result: 19 Þurh ða miclan flodas is min mod afylled 20 mid gefean, ðæt he ðæs fægnian mæg 21 ðæt he ðone bryne abidan mæg.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 Ditemi dunque, cara mia primizia, 23 quai fuor li vostri antichi e quai fuor li anni 24 che si segnaro in vostra püerizia;
query.error: **English:** 22 Tell me then, my dear first love, 23 who were your ancestors and what were the years 24 that were marked in your childhood;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 ditemi de l’ovil di San Giovanni 26 quanto era allora, e chi eran le genti 27 tra esso degne di più alti scanni».
query.error: **English:** 25 tell me about the sheepfold of San Giovanni, 26 how big it was then, and who were the people 27 among them worthy of the highest seats.
query.result: 25 sege me be ðam eowde Sancte Iohannis 26 hu mycel hit wæs ða, and hwa wæron ða leoda 27 betwux him ðe wæron wyrðe ðara heahstan setla.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 Come s’avviva a lo spirar d’i venti 29 carbone in fiamma, così vid’ io quella 30 luce risplendere a’ miei blandimenti;
query.error: **English:** 28 As a coal is quickened to flame by the breath of the winds, 29 so saw I that light glow at my entreaties; 30 and as it became fairer to my eyes,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 e come a li occhi miei si fé più bella, 32 così con voce più dolce e soave, 33 ma non con questa moderna favella,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 al suo Leon cinquecento cinquanta 38 e trenta fiate venne questo foco 39 a rinfiammarsi sotto la sua pianta.
query.error: **English:** 37 and thirty times this fire has come 38 to rekindle itself beneath its paw.
query.result: 37 to his Leone fif hund wintra 38 and ðritig ðis fyr com 39 ðæt hit hine eft ontende under his fotum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 Li antichi miei e io nacqui nel loco 41 dove si truova pria l’ultimo sesto 42 da quei che corre il vostro annüal gioco.
query.error: **English:** 40 My ancestors and I were born in the place 41 where the last sixth is found first 42 by those who run your annual race.
query.result: 40 Mine yldran and ic wæron acendede on ðæm stede 41 ðær ðæt ytemeste sixte is ærest funden 42 fram ðæm ðe rynnað eower gearlice plegan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 Basti d’i miei maggiori udirne questo: 44 chi ei si fosser e onde venner quivi, 45 più è tacer che ragionare onesto.
query.error: **English:** 43 Let it suffice for you to hear this about my ancestors: 44 who they were and how they came here, 45 it is more honorable to be silent than to speak.
query.result: 43 Genoh is ðæt ðe ðu gehyre ðisne hleopor: 44 hwa ða wæron and hwanan ða comon, 45 ðæt is betere ðæt ðu ðæt forbuge ðonne ðu ðæt reccan wille.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 Tutti color ch’a quel tempo eran ivi 47 da poter arme tra Marte e ’l Batista, 48 eran il quinto di quei ch’or son vivi.
query.error: **English:** 46 All those who were there at that time, 47 able to bear arms between March and June, 48 were a fifth of those who are alive now.
query.result: 46 Ealle ða ðe ða wæron on ðam gefeohte 47 ðe wæpna mihton hebban betwux Martius and Iunius, 48 wæron ða fifta dæl ðara ðe nu synd on life.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 Ma la cittadinanza, ch’è or mista 50 di Campi, di Certaldo e di Fegghine, 51 pura vediesi ne l’ultimo artista.
query.error: **English:** 49 But the citizenry, which is now mixed 50 with people from Campi, Certaldo, and Fegghine, 51 you could see purely in the last artist.
query.result: 49 Ac ða burhwaru, ðe nu is mencged 50 of Campum, of Certalde and of Fegghinum, 51 ðu mihtest on ðam æftemestan wyrhtan clæne geseon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 che averle dentro e sostener lo puzzo 56 del villan d’Aguglion, di quel da Signa, 57 che già per barattare ha l’occhio aguzzo!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
58 Se la gente ch’al mondo più traligna 59 non fosse stata a Cesare noverca, 60 ma come madre a suo figlio benigna,

query.result: 58 Gif ða leoda ðe on worulde mæst awyriað 59 næren wæron to Cesari stiopmodor, 60 ac swa swa modor to hire suna milde,

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
73 Se tu riguardi Luni e Orbisaglia 74 come sono ite, e come se ne vanno 75 di retro ad esse Chiusi e Sinigaglia,

query.result: 73 Gif ðu Luni and Orbisaglia 74 behealdeð hu hi wæron, and hu hi forð gewendon, 75 and æfter him Chiusi and Sinigaglia,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 udir come le schiatte si disfanno 77 non ti parrà nova cosa né forte, 78 poscia che le cittadi termine hanno.
query.error: **English:** 76 you will hear how the races of men are undone. 77 It will not seem new or strange to you, 78 since cities have their limits.
query.result: 76 ðu miht gehyran hu ða mægða forwurdon. 77 Ne ðinceð ðe ðæt wundorlic ne uncuð, 78 siððan ða burga ende habbað.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 Le vostre cose tutte hanno lor morte, 80 sì come voi; ma celasi in alcuna 81 che dura molto, e le vite son corte.
query.error: **English:** 79 All your things have their death, 80 just like you; but it is hidden in some things 81 that last a long time, and lives are short.
query.result: 79 Ealle ðine ðing habbað heora deað, 80 swa swa ðu; ac hit is gehŷded on sumum 81 ðe lange dreogað, and ða lif syndon sceorte.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 E come ’l volger del ciel de la luna 83 cuopre e discuopre i liti sanza posa, 84 così fa di Fiorenza la Fortuna:
query.error: **English:** 82 And just as the turning of the heavens and the moon 83 covers and uncovers the shores without pause, 84 so does Fortune do to Florence:
query.result: 82 And swa swa ðæs heofones hweorfan and ðære monan 83 bewrið and unwríð ða lyde butan reste, 84 swa dǽð Fortúna of Florentia:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
85 per che non dee parer mirabil cosa 86 ciò ch’io dirò de li alti Fiorentini 87 onde è la fama nel tempo nascosa.
query.error: **English:** 85 therefore it should not seem a wondrous thing 86 what I will say about the lofty Florentines 87 whose fame is hidden in time.
query.result: 85 forðæm ne sceal ðyncan wundorlic ðing 86 ðæt ic secge be ðæm héan Florentínum 87 ðæra is ða mǽrðe on ðære tíde gehýded.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 Io vidi li Ughi e vidi i Catellini, 89 Filippi, Greci, Ormanni e Alberichi, 90 già nel calare, illustri cittadini;
query.error: **English:** 88 I saw the Ughi and I saw the Catellini, 89 Filippi, Greci, Ormanni, and Alberichi, 90 already in decline, illustrious citizens;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
91 e vidi così grandi come antichi, 92 con quel de la Sannella, quel de l’Arca, 93 e Soldanieri e Ardinghi e Bostichi.
query.error: **English:** 91 and I saw some as great as the ancients, 92 with him of the Sannella, him of the Arca, 93 and Soldanieri and Ardinghi and Bostichi.
query.result: 91 and ic geseah sume swa micle swa ða ealdan, 92 mid ðam of ðære Sannella, ðam of ðære Arca, 93 and Soldanieri and Ardinghi and Bostichi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
94 Sovra la porta ch’al presente è carca 95 di nova fellonia di tanto peso 96 che tosto fia iattura de la barca,

query.result: 94 Ufan ðære geate ðe nu is gehefegad 95 mid niwan felanysse ðæs miclan gewihtes 96 ðæt hraðe bið iattura ðære bâte,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 erano i Ravignani, ond’ è disceso 98 il conte Guido e qualunque del nome 99 de l’alto Bellincione ha poscia preso.
query.error: **English:** 97 were the Ravignani, from whom descended 98 Count Guido and all those who have since taken 99 the name of the noble Bellincione.
query.result: 97 wæron ða Rafenware, ðanon is cumen 98 se eorl Guido and æghwilc ðara ðe siððan 99 ðæs hean Bellincones naman hæfð genumen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 Quel de la Pressa sapeva già come 101 regger si vuole, e avea Galigaio 102 dorata in casa sua già l’elsa e ’l pome.
query.error: **English:** 100 He of La Pressa already knew how 101 one must rule, and Galigaio 102 already had the hilt and pommel gilded in his house.
query.result: 100 Se ðe of ðære Pressan wiste ða georne 101 hu man sceolde ricsian, and hæfde Galigaio 102 on his huse ða gyldene æx and ðone pom.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 Grand’ era già la colonna del Vaio, 104 Sacchetti, Giuochi, Fifanti e Barucci 105 e Galli e quei ch’arrossan per lo staio.
query.error: **English:** 103 The column of the Vajo was already tall, 104 Sacchetti, Giuochi, Fifanti, and Barucci, 105 and Galli and those who blush for the bushel.
query.result: 103 Heh wæs seo Vaio columne heah, 104 Sacchetti, Giuochi, Fifanti, and Barucci, 105 and Galli and ða ðe for ðam staiele bleohð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 Lo ceppo di che nacquero i Calfucci 107 era già grande, e già eran tratti 108 a le curule Sizii e Arrigucci.
query.error: **English:** 106 The stock from which the Calfucci sprang 107 was now great, and already had produced 108 Sizii and Arrigucci, who were drawn
query.result: 106 Se ceppe of ðæm ða Calfucci comon 107 wæs ða mycel, and ða wæron getealde 108 to ðæm curulscetan Sizii and Arrigucci.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 Oh quali io vidi quei che son disfatti 110 per lor superbia! e le palle de l’oro 111 fiorian Fiorenza in tutt’ i suoi gran fatti.
query.error: **English:** 109 Oh, how many I saw there who were undone 110 through their pride! And the balls of gold 111 made Florence flourish in all her great deeds.
query.result: 109 Eala, hu manega ic ðær geseah ðara ðe forwurdon 110 ðurh heora ofermetto! and ða goldhorda 111 bleowdon Florentinan on eallum heora miclum weorcum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 Così facieno i padri di coloro 113 che, sempre che la vostra chiesa vaca, 114 si fanno grassi stando a consistoro.
query.error: **English:** 112 Thus did the fathers of those 113 who, whenever your church is vacant, 114 grow fat by staying in consistory.
query.result: 112 Swa dydon ða fæderas ðæra 113 ðe, swa oft swa eowre cyrice awesteð, 114 feormiað on ðam biscopstole.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 L’oltracotata schiatta che s’indraca 116 dietro a chi fugge, e a chi mostra ’l dente 117 o ver la borsa, com’ agnel si placa,
query.error: **English:** 115 The arrogant family that becomes enraged 116 against those who flee, and shows its teeth 117 or its purse, like a lamb is appeased,
query.result: 115 Se ofermodige mægð ðe ðe ondracað 116 æfter ðæm ðe flyð, and ðæm ðe ðone toð mæneð 117 oððe ofer ðone byrsean, swa ðæt lomb is gestilled,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 già venìa sù, ma di picciola gente; 119 sì che non piacque ad Ubertin Donato 120 che poï il suocero il fé lor parente.
query.error: **English:** 118 was already rising, but with a small following; 119 so that it did not please Ubertino Donato 120 that his father-in-law made them his relatives.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 Già era ’l Caponsacco nel mercato 122 disceso giù da Fiesole, e già era 123 buon cittadino Giuda e Infangato.
query.error: **English:** 121 Caponsacco was already in the marketplace, 122 having come down from Fiesole, and so was 123 the good citizen Giuda and Infangato.
query.result: 121 Wæs ða Caponsac on ðam ceapmange 122 ofstiged of Fiesole, and wæs ða 123 se goda burhware Giuda and Infangato.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 Io dirò cosa incredibile e vera: 125 nel picciol cerchio s’entrava per porta 126 che si nomava da quei de la Pera.
query.error: **English:** 124 I will tell you something incredible but true: 125 one entered the small circle through a gate 126 that was named by those from La Pera.
query.result: 124 Ic secge ðe unaliefne ðing and soð: 125 ðurh ðone lytlan hring man eode in ða duru 126 ðe ða men of ðære Peran nemnedon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 Ciascun che de la bella insegna porta 128 del gran barone il cui nome e ’l cui pregio 129 la festa di Tommaso riconforta,
query.error: **English:** 127 Each one who bears the fair ensign 128 of the great baron whose name and whose worth 129 the feast of Thomas comforts,
query.result: 127 Ælc ðara ðe ðære fægran tacne bær 128 ðæs mæran þegnes ðæs noma and ðæs lof 129 ðæs eadigan Thomas mæsse gefrefrode,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 da esso ebbe milizia e privilegio; 131 avvegna che con popol si rauni 132 oggi colui che la fascia col fregio.
query.error: **English:** 130 from him had soldiery and privilege; 131 although he gathers with the people today 132 he who binds the sash with the ornament.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
133 Già eran Gualterotti e Importuni; 134 e ancor saria Borgo più quïeto, 135 se di novi vicin fosser digiuni.
query.error: **English:** 133 Already there were the Gualterotti and the Importuni; 134 and Borgo would still be quieter, 135 if it were empty of new neighbors.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
136 La casa di che nacque il vostro fleto, 137 per lo giusto disdegno che v’ha morti 138 e puose fine al vostro viver lieto,
query.error: **English:** 136 The house from which your weeping was born, 137 through the just disdain that has killed you 138 and put an end to your happy life,
query.result: 136 Þæt hus of ðæm ðin wóp wearð geboren, 137 ðurh ðone rihtwisan yfelwillan ðe eow hæfð ofslægen 138 and ðinum blissigan life ende geworht,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
139 era onorata, essa e suoi consorti: 140 o Buondelmonte, quanto mal fuggisti 141 le nozze süe per li altrui conforti!
query.error: **English:** 139 was honored, it and its people: 140 O Buondelmonte, how badly you fled 141 his marriage at the urging of others!
query.result: 139 wæs gewuldrod, hit and his geferan: 140 Ea, Buondelmonte, hu yfle ðu ðine 141 gifta forðfluge ðurh ðara oðerra ræd!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
142 Molti sarebber lieti, che son tristi, 143 se Dio t’avesse conceduto ad Ema 144 la prima volta ch’a città venisti.
query.error: **English:** 142 Many would be joyful, who are sad, 143 if God had granted you to Emma 144 the first time you came to the city.
query.result: 142 Manega wæron bliðe, ðe nu sind sarige, 143 gif God ðe hæfde gegynned to Emman 144 ða ðu ærest to ðære byrig come.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
145 Ma conveniesi a quella pietra scema 146 che guarda ’l ponte, che Fiorenza fesse 147 vittima ne la sua pace postrema.
query.error: **English:** 145 But you must go to that truncated stone 146 that guards the bridge, which Florence made 147 a victim in its final peace.
query.result: 145 Ac ðu scealt to ðæm sceamestan 146 ðe ðone brycg bewerið, ðe Florentia worhte 147 lac on hire æftemestan sibbe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
148 Con queste genti, e con altre con esse, 149 vid’ io Fiorenza in sì fatto riposo, 150 che non avea cagione onde piangesse.
query.error: **English:** 148 With these people, and with others with them, 149 I saw Florence in such a state of peace, 150 that it had no reason to weep.
query.result: 148 Mid ðyssum folce and oðrum mid him, 149 ic geseah Florentia on ðam sibbe, 150 ðæt heo næfde nane sorge hwy heo wepan sceolde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
151 Con queste genti vid’io glorïoso 152 e giusto il popol suo, tanto che ’l giglio 153 non era ad asta mai posto a ritroso,
query.error: **English:** 151 With these people I saw glorious 152 and just his people, so much so that the lily 153 was never placed upside down on a staff,
query.result: 151 Mid ðyssum folce ic geseah ðone arwurðan 152 and ðone rihtwisan his folces werod, swa ðæt ðæt lilie 153 næfre nære on stæfne æfre asett æfter bæce,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
154 né per divisïon fatto vermiglio».
query.error: **English:** 154 nor made red by division.
query.result: 154 ne ðurh todælednysse geworht read.
